Dear Mr. Hawkins:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to
the violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, the area manager at (616) 204-

ALLEGATION:
On 9/28/21, youth was sexually assaulted in the bathroom at school by a classmate.
Youth disclosed limited information to staff at facility on 9/28/21. Staff said that they
would fill out a report but did not go further as the incident was reported as
harassment initially.
INVESTIGATION:
I interviewed the DHHS Case Manager by phone on 10/5/21. She reported not
being aware of the allegations but plans on contacting Youth A and visiting the
facility as soon as possible. She also reported Youth A has a history of experiencing
sexual abuse.
I left a phone message for the complainant on 10/5/21.
I interviewed Administrator 1 and Administrator 2 at the facility on 10/6/21.
They reported having awareness of the allegations and reported that the incident
was not “called in” until Youth A gave “full disclosure” on 10/4/21. They reported
Youth A gave several different accounts of the incident to different staff.
I interviewed Youth A at the facility on 10/6/21. Youth A reported telling
Supervisor 1 on 10/1/21 but reported “I didn’t tell him the whole story”. Youth A also
reported telling Staff 1 on 10/2/21 and telling “more than I told Supervisor 1”. Youth
A reported telling no other staff except these two staff.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 by phone on 10/6/21. He reported not suspecting
abuse because “Youth A told me nothing happened in the bathroom”. He also
reported Youth A told him another student took Youth A’s backpack and went into
the boy’s restroom. He reported informing the Clinical Supervisor and Case Manager
1. He also reported Case Manager 1 informed him that she was in communication
with the school about the incident. He reported not making a report to the police or
DHHS because “I didn’t have more information that led to abuse” but he did
complete a Critical Incident Report (CIR). He reported if hearing about an attempted
rape he would have reported the information to DHHS and the police.
3

I interviewed Staff 1 by phone on 10/6/21. She reported being told by Youth A on
10/2/21 that “a male peer at school tried to rape Youth A”. She also reported
completing a CIR and informing Supervisor 2 of the information provided. Staff 1
reported asking Youth A if she informed anyone else and having Youth A state, “I
told Supervisor 1 earlier”. She reported Supervisor 2 told her to write a new CIR
because of new information and she never read the other CIRs, so she didn’t know
what Youth A had told to Supervisor 1. She ended when she reported Supervisor 2
informed her “the incident had already been reported”.
I interviewed Staff 2 by phone on 10/6/21. She reported being told by Youth C
about an incident in school involving Youth A and a male student on 9/28/21. She
also reported being told that Youth A provided oral sex to the male student but being
told nothing more. She reported writing a CIR and informing Supervisor 3 of the
information. She reported if a youth reported they were raped she would have called
in the report and contacted the police.
I interviewed Staff 3 by phone on 10/6/21. He reported being told by Youth A on
9/28/21 that Youth A did not engage in oral sex with a male student at the school.
He stated, “Youth A was very adamant that it didn’t occur”. He also reported he
would follow procedures and report the incident if Youth A said she had been
abused.
I interviewed Case Manager 1 by phone on 10/6/21. She reported being aware of
a male student asking Youth A for a sexual favor but was unable to identify how she
was informed of this situation. She also reported contacting the school for additional
information and provided the school report. She reported “never hearing about an
assault until after the report by Youth A, at which time she contacted the DHHS
Case Manager. She also reported not making a formal report because she “didn’t
suspect abuse, only had secondhand information”, and “normally we don’t do a 3200
for kid-on-kid sexual activity”.
I interviewed Supervisor 2 by phone on 10/6/21. He reported being informed of
the attempted rape on 10/2/21 by Staff 1. He also reported telling Staff 1 “it has been
previously reported to Supervisor 1 and Case Manager “. He reported knowing this
because of the documentation on the other CIRs that were provided. He also
reported he should have followed up with Youth A and “made a report”. He reported
“there were other things going on and I didn’t have a chance to follow up before
leaving campus at 10:00 PM”. He also reported Youth A was in bed when he left
campus. He reported this was a mistake and “on me”.
I interviewed Staff 4 by phone on 10/6/21. She reported being informed by Youth
A that a rape had occurred, so she completed a CIR. She also reported Youth A told
her that she had “told other staff and supervisors about the incident”. She reported
Case Manager 2 called the police after talking with Youth A the same day she found
out from Youth A. She reported DHHS and the police should have been called when
Youth A provided information that supported suspected abuse.
4

I interviewed Case Manager 2 by phone on 10/6/21. She reported first hearing
about a “rape” on 10/4/21 and calling the police the same day. She also reported
Youth A complained that “no one is doing anything about the rape” and that this was
the first time she heard the term “rape” about the incident. She denied being aware
of the CIR written on 10/2/21 that documented “attempted rape”. She reported
knowing the process for suspected abuse and knowing what action she is to take,
thus calling the police the same day.
I interviewed Supervisor 3 by phone on 10/6/21. He reported learning about a
“rape” on 10/4/21 and reviewing two other CIRs that never documented a “rape”. He
reported the other two CIRs documented an incident with a backpack and Youth A
waiting to get the backpack until the male student left the bathroom. He reported if
knowing about the CIR written on 10/2/21 he “would have called the police”.
Documents Reviewed:
I reviewed the Critical Incident Reports (CIR) regarding the alleged incident.
The first CIR was dated 9/28/21 at 11 PM and completed by Staff 2. This document
states the following.
Youth C came up to this staff and said that Youth B told her that Youth A told
them that they had sucked another students dick in the bathroom at school
this morning. Youth A then told Staff 3 that it wasn't true.
This document notes the “action taken” involved informing Supervisor 3.
The second CIR was dated 10/1/21 6:30 AM and completed by Supervisor 1. This
document states the following.
Youth A had a closed fist while shaking their legs under the table rapidly
during group therapy. Supervisor 1 noticed that something was on Youth A’s
mind. Supervisor 1 asked Youth A if they wanted to speak in the den. Youth A
said that they would like too. Once in the den, Youth A told Supervisor 1 of an
event at school. A junior peer was in the hallway. He asked Youth A to go into
the bathroom with him. Youth A didn’t want to. Then he took Youth A’s
backpack into the bathroom. Youth A said to the writer, " I'm not no bitch so I
went into the bathroom to get it back". Once in the bathroom Youth A’s peer
asked for sexual favors in order to get their backpack. Youth A refused and
left the bathroom and went quickly to class. Later, Youth A return to the
bathroom to get her backpack when it was safe.
The action taken on this document states the following.
Supervisor 1 debrief with Youth A and thanked them for trusting him with this
information. Supervisor 1 shared this information to Youth A’s case manager
(Case Manager 1). Case Manager 1 was already in contact with the school,
5

regarding their investigation.
The third CIR was dated 10/2/21 8:55 PM and completed by Staff 1. This document
states the following.
During a conversation with Staff 1, Youth A disclosed that a male peer at
school, "tried to rape" them. When Staff 1 asked for more information about
the incident, Youth A stated that they were in the hallway and the peer took
their MP3 player without asking, then he took the MP3 player into the male
restroom. In order to retrieve the MP3 player, Youth A went into the male
restroom after the male peer, although they did not want to go in there. Youth
A further stated that while in the bathroom, the peer elicited a sexual favor
and attempted to take down Youth A's pants. Youth A started to cry so Staff
1 did not push the conversation any further. Youth A reported they informed
the principal and Supervisor 3 on Wednesday (9-29), and Case Manager 2
was informed on Friday (10-1).
The action taken is documented, “Staff 1 shared the information with leadership on
shift (supervisor 2). CIR was written and emailed to Residential notification group.”
The fourth CIR was dated 10/4/21 10:59 PM and completed by Staff 4. The
document states the following.
Youth A stated that she was raped by a boy at her school. Originally this was
followed up through staff and supervisors. However, staff were given the
information that Youth A was feeling uncomfortable by a boy and had not
realized that she had been raped. After talking with Youth A, Case Manager 2
called the police. Later a follow-up call was placed to the police that Youth A
had stated that she was fine talking to the police in the morning but police
came out at night. Youth A gave her report to the police that night.”
The action taken is documented. “Youth A talked to police and with staff. Youth A
gave report. CIR was written and sent to Residential notification group.”
I reviewed the “Incident Notification Policy” for the facility. This document states the
following actions to be taken. “Incidents involving abuse of a foster child shall be
reported as soon as possible but not more than 24 hours after the incident to:
 Children’s Protective Services
 Child’s parents/legal guardian
 Responsible agency
 Guardian ad litem as applicable”
I reviewed HR documentation regarding Supervisor 2. There were two disciplinary
actions taken with Supervisor 2 documented in the HR file. The first occurred on
3/26/18 and involved “poor and improper work” resulting in a “verbal warning”. The
incidents leading to this action involve Supervisor 2 failing to sign the medication
6

administration record on six different occasions. The second disciplinary action took
place on 2/4/19 and resulted in a second “verbal warning”. This incident involved
Supervisor 2 telling a youth “you should just kill yourself”. It is documented that
Supervisor 2 “was playing around as they often joke around like this”. It is also
documented “Supervisor 2 states that he would not joke with peers like this in the
future”.
I reviewed the Job Description for Supervisors at the facility. This document is titled
“Residential Campus-Wide Supervisor”. Within this document it is stated, “The
supervisor must understand safety plans and major triggers for each student and will
provide clear direction to these staff in crisis management situations”. Further duties
and responsibilities state the following.
Facilitate a culture of exceptional client care which meets or exceeds
contract, licensing and accreditation standards. Provide coaching and role
model leadership for YDS staff including strategies that build capacity to
respond effectively to needs of the students. Self-starter who is able to
identify challenges and be self-directed in developing solutions.
Demonstrated compatibility working in an environment that demands the
highest levels of collaboration, cooperation, communication, participation,
trust, respect, and mutual accountability and responsiveness to leadership
supervision.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff
qualifications.
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the
following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position
assigned.
7

ANALYSIS: Evidence provided through interviews and written
documentation do not support the allegations of staff failing to
report suspected abuse to child protective services. However
Supervisor 2 did fail to provide for the safety of Youth A when he
was informed on 10/2/21 that Youth A reported being raped and
failed to follow up, notify upper management or contact law
enforcement.
Technical Assistance:
After reviewing the facility’s incident report policy, it was
recommended clarification be added to the policy regarding
what is meant by abuse, and how staff should respond when a
youth reports they were assaulted (physical or sexually) not by a
staff person
